definition: unable to go to school/an interruption to one's education

sentences.english: Now in the rural areas, there are many children out of school.
sentences.chinese: 现今，在农村地区还有良多孩子失学。

sentences.english: We should decrease the drop-out rate at school by promoting compulsory education.
sentences.chinese: 我们要通过推行义务教育来不断降低失学率。

sentences.english: Many rural poverty, the high rate of school drop-outs, especially girls.
sentences.chinese: 许多贫困的农村，失学率很高，尤其是女孩。

sentences.english: She was deprived of schooling at ten.
Millions of children are still unschooled.
He was made to leave school by his father's death.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲的归天使他不患上不失学。

sentences.english: THE EDIFIER - On-line magazine promoting the edification of the body of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 漫步者安在线杂志推广失学基督身体。

sentences.english: This Foundation engages in helping the drop-outs.
sentences.chinese: 这个基金会致力于帮助失学儿童。

definition: to drop out of school/to leave off studying/to interrupt one's studies
percentage of children who enter school
"left-behind children", rural children whose parents have to make a living as migrant workers in distant urban areas, but cannot afford to keep the family with them
to go to school/to attend school
excelling both in morals and studies (idiom); top marks for studies and for behavior (at school)/a paragon of virtue and learning
to work part time while studying/work-study program
